metadata.title: CVE-2014-3578 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in Pivotal Spring Framework 3.x before3.2.9 and 4.0 before 4.0.5 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary filesvia a crafted URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3578` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-beans-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-context-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-context-support-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-core-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-expression-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-instrument-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-jdbc-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-jms-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-orm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-oxm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-test-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-transaction-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-web-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
libspring-web-struts-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm1').
